outputValidation.content:
{
  "problem_id": "P05",
  "final_answer": {
    "value": 0.889,
    "units": "g",
    "precision_note": "Current and time given to 3 s.f., Faraday constant to 3 s.f., atomic mass to 4 s.f. Result reported to 3 significant figures."
  },
  "method": "First, convert time to seconds: 30.0 min * 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge Q = I * t = 1.50 * 1800 = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 / 96,500 = 0.027979 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of copper. So n(Cu) = 0.027979 / 2 = 0.013990 mol. Calculate mass m = n * Ar = 0.013990 * 63.55 = 0.889 g.",
  "key_equations": [
    "Q = I * t",
    "n(e-) = Q / F",
    "Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu"
  ],
  "line_refs": [
    "L19",
    "L24",
    "L51",
    "L52"
  ],
  "checks": [
    "1 Ampere is 1 Coulomb per second. 1.5 A for 1800s is 2700 C.",
    "96500 C is 1 mol e-. 2700 is small fraction (~3%). Result 0.89g is reasonable for small current/time."
  ]
}

value.summary: All six JSON outputs are consistent with the provided report data and equations, with no fabricated quantities or unsupported assumptions. Calculations match the specified formulas and constants: P01 correctly applies c1V1=c2V2 using the given volumes (L16, L29–L30); P02 correctly accounts for 84.0% purity, uses the given Mr values/atomic data, and applies the 1:1 CaCO3:CO2 stoichiometry from the stated equation (L14, L24–L26, L33–L36); P03 correctly uses the titration stoichiometry (1:2) and c=
